entry.name: MAV_SWARM_TYPE_V
entry.description: V-Formation

entry.name: MAV_SWARM_TYPE_X
entry.description: X-Formation

entry.name: MAV_SWARM_TYPE_CIRCLE
entry.description: Circle-Formation

entry.name: MAV_SWARM_TYPE_GRID
entry.description: Uniform matrix grid
entry.param: width (number of MAVs in one row)

enum.name: MAV_SWARM_JOIN_RESULT
enum.description: Defines possible MAV swarm joining outcomes.

entry.name: MAV_SWARM_JOIN_RESULT_SUCCESS
entry.description: MAV successfully reached it's position in the swarm.

entry.name: MAV_SWARM_JOIN_RESULT_UNREACHABLE
entry.description: MAV is not able to reach it's position in the swarm.

entry.name: MAV_SWARM_JOIN_RESULT_NO_SWARM
entry.description: MAV is not part of a valid swarm.

entry.name: MAV_SWARM_JOIN_RESULT_OCCUPIED
entry.description: MAV position was already occupied by another MAV. This is a critical error and should be analyzed.

entry.name: MAV_SWARM_JOIN_RESULT_FAILED
entry.description: MAV is not able to occupy a position for any other reason.

enum.name: MAV_REGION_OPTION
enum.description: Possible options for a region (can be combined using OR statement).

entry.name: MAV_REGION_OPTION_NO_LAND
entry.description: Landing is forbidden. For this region, Z-coordinate would be ignored.

entry.name: MAV_REGION_OPTION_NO_FLY
entry.description: Flight through this region is not allowed.

entry.name: MAV_REGION_OPTION_EMERGENCY_LANDING
entry.description: Emergency landing region. In case if there is a need in emergency landing, the next accessible emergency landing region will be used. This option can't be used with options above.

enum.name: MAV_REPLACE_PRIORITY_RESULT
enum.description: Possible results for the GCS assisted replacement process

entry.name: MAV_REPLACE_PRIORITY_RESULT_SUCCESS
entry.description: An allowed MAV was successfully used as a replacement MAV. (The process has already been completed.)

entry.name: MAV_REPLACE_PRIORITY_RESULT_NONE_ALLOWED
entry.description: There is no MAV from a priority list, which can be used as replacement for the MAV.

entry.name: MAV_REPLACE_PRIORITY_RESULT_TIMEOUT
entry.description: The replacement process was aborted because it reached the timeout.

entry.name: MAV_REPLACE_PRIORITY_RESULT_FAILED
entry.description: The replacement process was aborted because of any other reason.

enum.name: MAV_CHARGE_POINT_STATUS
enum.description: Possible states of a charging station (see CHARGE_CONFIRM enum for an additional information)

entry.name: MAV_CHARGE_POINT_STATUS_FREE
entry.description: Charging station is operating and free. Landing is allowed.

entry.name: MAV_CHARGE_POINT_STATUS_OCCUPIED
entry.description: Charging station is occupied now.

entry.name: MAV_CHARGE_POINT_STATUS_DISABLED
entry.description: Charging station is out of operation now.

enum.name: MAV_CHARGE_RESULT
enum.description: Possible results of a charging process

entry.name: MAV_CHARGE_RESULT_FULL
entry.description: Fully charged

entry.name: MAV_CHARGE_RESULT_ERROR
entry.description: Error occurred during charging.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_GROUP_SET
entry.description: Command is sent by QGroundControl, instructing MAV to which group it should belong.
entry.param: Group ID (old group ID will be overwritten)
Group member ID (unique inside group, starting from 1)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_GROUP_UPDATE
entry.description: Command is sent by QGroundControl, instructing all MAVs to which group they should belong, who will be the group leader and how many group members exist. Previous group leaders lose their status.
entry.param: Group member ID (ID of a new group leader).

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SWARM_SET
entry.description: Apply a swarm formation. Each formation requires four parameters at most. (see MAV_SWARM_TYPE enum).
entry.param: Scaling in cm (e.g., "100" for one meter as a basic unit)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_JOIN_SWARM
entry.description: Instruct all group members to begin a swarm construction. The MAV with ID 1 begins first. Then it sends SWARM_JOINED message, so that MAV with ID 2 can start as well.
entry.param: Type of the coordinate system (see MAV_FRAME enum)
x-coordinate of a group member with ID 1 (leader)
y-coordinate of a group member with ID 1 (leader)
z-coordinate of a group member with ID 1 (leader)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_HEAD
entry.description: Flight with a constant speed in the specified direction.
entry.param: Group ID (can be set to "0" if individual MAV is meant)
Type of the coordinate system (see MAV_FRAME enum)

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_FLY_TO
entry.description: Flight to the specified way point. The MAV will start as soon as the speed is specified (MAV_CMD_DO_CHANGE_SPEED).
entry.param: Group ID (can be set to "0" if individual MAV is meant)
Type of the coordinate system (see MAV_FRAME enum)

message.name: GROUP_SET
message.description: See MAV_CMD_DO_GROUP_SET enum
message.field: Group ID (old group ID will be overwritten)
Group member ID (unique inside group, starting from 1)

message.name: GROUP_UPDATE
message.description: See MAV_CMD_DO_GROUP_UPDATE enum
message.field: Group member ID (ID of a new group leader).

message.name: GROUP_REQUEST_ALL
message.description: Command is sent by QGroundControl to all MAVs and calls all the members of a group. Called members can answer with GROUP_MEMBER message.

message.name: GROUP_REQUEST
message.description: Command is sent by QGroundControl to all MAVs And calls the specified member of a group. Called member can answer with GROUP_MEMBER message.
message.field: Group member ID (unique inside group, starting from 1)

message.name: GROUP_MEMBER
message.description: Answer to GROUP_REQUEST or GROUP_REQUEST_ALL
message.field: Group member ID (unique inside group, starting from 1)

message.name: SWARM_SET
message.description: See MAV_CMD_DO_SWARM_SET

message.name: SWARM_JOIN
message.description: See MAV_CMD_NAV_JOIN_SWARM
message.field: Type of the coordinate system (see MAV_FRAME enum)
x-coordinate of a group member with ID 1 (leader)
y-coordinate of a group member with ID 1 (leader)
z-coordinate of a group member with ID 1 (leader)

message.name: SWARM_JOINED
message.description: Command is sent from the MAV to all other MAVs to inform them about successful or not successful operation of joining swarm and coordinates of the MAV's position.
message.field: Type of the coordinate system (see MAV_FRAME enum)

message.name: REGION_CLEAR
message.description: Remove the region. Can be necessary if the region needs to be redefined.

message.name: REGION_CLEAR_ALL
message.description: Remove all regions.

message.name: REGION_DEFINE_POLYGON
message.description: The beginning of the region definition in terms of a spanned polygon. This message requires REGION_POLYGON_EDGE message, where corner points of the polygon are defined.
message.field: Defines, what is allowed or forbidden (see MAV_REGION_OPTION enum).
Number of corner points of the polygon
Type of the coordinate system (see MAV_FRAME enum)
z-coordinate of the lower surface of the polygon region. The symbol "- infinity" defines the region starting everywhere from the ground level.
Height of the polygonal region. The symbol "+ infinity" defines the region with infinite height.

message.name: REGION_POLYGON_EDGE_REQUEST
message.description: Request a vertex of a polygonal region
message.field: Sequence number (i-t corner point of a polygon)
Number of corner points requested (from the i-t corner point of a polygon, in between 1 and 6)

message.name: REGION_POLYGON_EDGE
message.description: Definition of a corner point of a polygonal region. (the maximum numbers of corner points is 6, because the message should not be bigger than 64 Byte (fragmentation).)
message.field: Number of corner points starting from sequence number seq_no.

message.name: REGION_DEFINE_CUBOID
message.description: Definition of a cuboid region using two corner points
message.field: Defines, what is allowed or forbidden (see MAV_REGION_OPTION enum).
Type of the coordinate system (see MAV_FRAME enum)
z-coordinate point 1 (can get the value "- infinity" or "+ infinity")
z-coordinate point 2 (can get the value "- infinity" or "+ infinity")

message.name: REGION_DEFINE_CYLINDER
message.description: Definition of a cylinder region using the middle point and radius (using "infinite" height).
message.field: Defines, what is allowed or forbidden (see MAV_REGION_OPTION enum).
Type of the coordinate system (see MAV_FRAME)
x-coordinate of the bottom surface of the cylinder region.
y-coordinate of the bottom surface of the cylinder region.
z-coordinate of the bottom surface of the cylinder region. The symbol "- infinity" defines the region starting everywhere from the ground level.
Height of the cylinder region. The symbol "+ infinity" defines the region with infinite height.

message.name: REGION_SET_OPTIONS
message.description: Re-definition of the allowed/forbidden actions in the region

message.name: REPLACEMENT_REQUEST
message.description: General broadcast message for a MAV replacement. (Detailed data of MAVs states can be requested using SYS_STATUS message). Potential replacement-MAV answers with REPLACEMENT_CONFIRM message.
message.field: Bit mask with a coded components, which the replacement-UAV should have to be able to achieve mission goals (see MAV_SYS_STATUS_SENSOR enum).
The soonest time to exchange (UNIX-time in seconds).
The latest time to exchange (UNIX-time in seconds).
Mission priority (from 0 to 9, from low to high priority)
Type of the coordinate system (see MAV_FRAME enum)
x-coordinate of a meeting point with the replacement-MAV
y-coordinate of a meeting point with the replacement-MAV
z-coordinate of a meeting point with the replacement-MAV

message.name: REPLACEMENT_CONFIRM
message.description: Answer from the potential replacement-MAV to a REPLACEMENT_REQUEST message.
message.field: Estimated remaining time of the MAV flight.
Type of the coordinate system (see MAV_FRAME enum)

message.name: REPLACEMENT_PRIORITY
message.description: Message can be sent by QGroundControl (QGC) as an answer to REPLACEMENT_REQUEST message. In this message, replacement-MAVs can be specified (using System ID). When the replacement process is finished (success or failure), a REPLACEMENT_PRIORITY_CONFIRM message is sent to the QGC.
message.field: Length of the list (in between 0 and 10); "0": any MAV is approved
System-ID of potential replacement-MAVs (Index 1 = the highest priority)
Waiting time for the replacement-MAV (from replace_system) to come

message.name: REPLACEMENT_PRIORITY_CONFIRM
message.description: Message should be send by MAV as an answer to REPLACEMENT_PRIORITY message. The message informs QGroundControl about the outcome of the replacement process.
message.field: Result of the replacement process (see MAV_REPLACE_PRIORITY_RESULT enum)

message.name: REPLACEMENT_ACKNOWLEDGE
message.description: Answer to a REPLACEMENT_CONFIRM message.

message.name: REPLACEMENT_FINALIZE
message.description: The new (replacement-)MAV confirms that it replaces the old MAV. The old MAV should answer with REPLACEMENT_FINILIZE_END message.

message.name: REPLACEMENT_FINALIZE_END
message.description: The old MAV confirms that it is replaced already.
message.field: System ID of a contracted MAV (from QGroundControl)

message.name: CHARGE_POINTS_ANNOUNCE
message.description: The number of charging stations
message.field: Type of the coordinate system (see MAV_FRAME enum)

message.name: CHARGE_POINT_REQUEST
message.description: The charging station with a specified sequence number.

message.name: CHARGE_POINT
message.description: Place of the charging station
message.field: Orientation of the charging station in x-direction
Orientation of the charging station in y-direction
Orientation of the charging station in z-direction

message.name: CHARGE_POINT_HEAD
message.description: Message is sent by a MAV before the flight to a charging station. The state of batteries can be obtained using BATTERY_STATUS (for example, from QGroundControl).

message.name: CHARGE_REQUEST
message.description: Message is sent by a MAV to a charging station in order to request charging.

message.name: CHARGE_CONFIRM
message.description: Message is sent from a charging station to a MAV in order to share the state of a charging station. If the charging station is free (status == MAV_CHARGE_POINT_STATUS_FREE), CHARGE_BEGIN message is sent to the MAV.
message.field: If charging station is occupied (status == MAV_CHARGE_POINT_STATUS_OCCUPIED), this field shows how long this station will be occupied in seconds.

message.name: CHARGE_BEGIN
message.description: After this message is sent by the MAV, the charging station is busy and the MAV starts landing. Immediately after the landing, the charging process is started.

message.name: CHARGE_END
message.description: Message is sent by the charging station to the MAV in case of end of the charging process (full batteries or a failure). After this message, the MAV should leave the station.
message.field: Result of the charging process (from the point of view of the charging station; see MAV_CHARGE_RESULT enum)

message.name: NAV_HEAD
message.description: See Commands MAV_CMD_DO_HEAD
message.field: Group ID (can be set to "0" if a specific MAV is meant)
Type of the coordinate system (see MAV_FRAME enum)

message.name: NAV_SECURITY_AREA
message.description: Definition of an area (if a form of a sphere), where no other MAVs are allowed.
message.field: Group ID (can be set to "0" if a specific MAV is meant)
